title: Grade 4
subject: College and Career Ready Standards for Literacy (CCRSL)(2017-)

document.title: DoDEA College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects CCRSL Grades Kindergarten - Five

22FD042FBB3344869B4FF507C52FADCB.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic
and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that
signal precise actions, emotions, or statements of being (e.g.,
quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular
topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when
discussing animal preservation).

D67FF1E0BD9D4A0D8D4328E3117E8147.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to
their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but
not identical meanings(synonyms).

A051299AF10D4B54971796F04156DD99.description:
Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms,
adages, and proverbs.

4F3F7A7CD4224E80968E4D6342BA41BA.description:
Explain the meaning ofsimple similes and metaphors (e.g.,
as pretty as a picture) in context.

0C47DF232E4B46AEAAD1DDD24AD22AD9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word
relationships, and nuancesin word meanings.

39ADA04EDF1A4AAB9502CCB26FA35559.description:
Consultreference materials(e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the
pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning
of key words and phrases.

13BB8CABC75E4F709B5CDA8059EB23F8.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes
and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g.,
telegraph, photograph, autograph).

334471E7C35848E58A4432413BBB30B5.description:
Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, orstatements in
text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

A140D5C82FC6425E91B9F95C30BACFB2.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and
content, choosing flexibly from a range ofstrategies.

44556826441A4F27901DB47CB60C5CCE.description:
Differentiate between contextsthat call for formal English
(e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal
discourse is appropriate (e.g.,small-group discussion).Â

962814B71012447BA10B0AC94CCA6F68.description: Choose words and phrasesto convey ideas precisely.

A9D0FEF9BA8C4D43BFF056B08F004D2F.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing,
speaking, reading, orlistening.

08EF75CDB2194C6DA733B306EE17F134.description:
Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting
references as needed.

B46D5CFED6C8490A916E697B2F8B625B.description:
Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a
compoundsentence.

768C8F5630AD422689EF9849E98F2651.description:
Use commas and quotation marksto mark directspeech
and quotations from a text.

9B67C9D6E9C24660BC21C3DCF75E89A2.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions ofstandard English
capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

0AAF7E1FDA764135B892A41113D41DC2.description:
Correctly use frequently confused words(e.g., to, too, two;
there, their).

C336734FB69F4688B6A65DA008BA021D.description:
Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting
inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

6FE00D634E6E4DFCABC374BA5D3ADA00.description:
Order adjectives within sentences according to
conventional patterns(e.g., a small red bag rather than a
red small bag).

EB6D6B3545D9484082605C92E9F3775E.description:
Use modal auxiliaries(e.g., can, may, must) to convey
various conditions.

BE8E68CEA36C46B69AC6EB277E586BF6.description:
Form and use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am
walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.Â

327CCB5819CB4713A69135FBBE21EB40.description:
Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that)
and relative adverbs(where, when, why).

DDC46F5F1AE148CC85BE6D5E2270093C.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions ofstandard English
grammar and usage when writing orspeaking.

910871B63127486F8698EC9D80C560F7.description:
Differentiate between contextsthat call for formal English (e.g.,
presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is
appropriate (e.g.,small-group discussion); use formal English
when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 4 Language
standards 1 and 3 forspecific expectations.)

F54BD5D7BC11486AB8E37F29BC15961D.description:
Add audio recordings and visual displaysto presentations
when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or
themes.

EAC8FFB63F89456890635EE3233DED86.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in
an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant,
descriptive detailsto support main ideas or themes;speak clearly
at an understandable pace.

1A3FB28E1B794C92AED8703C359930D3.description:
Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support
particular points.

81E8E69E9F7F4B4DB04EF51F160C886F.description:
Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information
presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

BE23B19864994AF892E1DC8253E41ADE.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas
and understanding in light of the discussion.

CDDBA9754F4A4286A22828672859AE89.description:
Pose and respond to specific questionsto clarify or follow
up on information, and make commentsthat contribute to
the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

6F8DC74826EB4167A17E228EE96216A0.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out
assigned roles.

FAAA1880FBC34B18A41125CC5E5BAB60.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read orstudied
required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and
other information known about the topic to explore ideas
under discussion.

C8FC6E38E34F4880B6FCDD8357032EFA.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (oneon-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on
grade 4 topics and texts, building on othersâ ideas and expressing
their own clearly.

2E39108AA0BB4A2EBFA322EE4F5056F2.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames(time for research,
reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames(a single sitting
or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

AB3A47E6C13C4FF2AE236A0B3B1C28D6.description:
Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts
(e.g., "Explain how an author usesreasons and evidence to
support particular pointsin a text.").

91B82BDBD31B498A9C8B8E03815DD336.description:
Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g.,
"Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story
or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a
character'sthoughts, words, or actions].").

0FE3411FDAD744FFA1A0D8E637B939EC.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

38DDC792170B484B8CDC40E9DAD888CA.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant
information from print and digitalsources; take notes and
categorize information, and provide a list ofsources.

BFF3727BDF1D4617B6872B4BD5DD43A4.description:
Conductshort research projectsthat build knowledge through
investigation of different aspects of a topic.

A8900D2D3205494BB2AB2CDF6081E99C.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

10A754A009F94A36915AAA8F8A644D0E.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology,
including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as
to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient
command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in
a single sitting.

9DA2494C0B2A4D4CB6CB1BCBBD63132F.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and
strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.
(Editing for conventionsshould demonstrate command of
Language standards 1â3 up to and including grade 4.)

E624CC4E48D34425AAA8CE36E57B1DC1.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development
and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
(Grade-specific expectationsfor writing types are defined in
standards 1â3.)

EC803756B9344FFD89A8A83189DCA078.description:
Provide a conclusion that followsfrom the narrated
experiences or events.

D23ECF8353DC4344A23B7499A568EA92.description:
Use concrete words and phrases and sensory detailsto
convey experiences and events precisely.

0BCA58C5682440EE8E8566A301332F49.description:
Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage
the sequence of events.

F0683676E6E14880B83BC772A0B68CCD.description:
Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and
events orshow the responses of characters to situations.Â

E971554990BA415A91A1D069D0B7E8B4.description:
Orient the reader by establishing a situation and
introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event
sequence that unfolds naturally.

3FD1C2ED4B58494DBF1B4EA98189AAE0.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear
eventsequences.

BB99A71B80EC4824ACE267B0091F3DE7.description:
Provide a concluding statement orsection related to the
information or explanation presented.

58B2FE18728C4DC7BE50A07E6BC5D175.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic.

26831B0C011A487F95A6B60CAFF09C4F.description:
Link ideas within categories of information using words and
phrases(e.g., another, for example, also, because).

B6F812CE956C4C00B5D75F69A18B5AF4.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and examplesrelated to
the topic.

922629F1705043268702DF3F4129D752.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in
paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g.,
headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to
aiding comprehension.

390D4DA81E0C4C188F110057A35D5388.description:
Write informative/explanatory textsto examine a topic and
convey ideas and information clearly.

596EB63103FD426C9D54BE50CCA4347B.description:
Provide a concluding statement orsection related to the
opinion presented.

A90B44EDEA8E4D40A5C6BF5159DAEC5C.description:
Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases
(e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

06761FCB9CA14CDE86E83F38B4408F15.description: Provide reasonsthat are supported by facts and details.

18CA6D647C5A481A99F6DCC9B99118E5.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and
create an organizationalstructure in which related ideas
are grouped to support the writerâs purpose.

26FAC3D362C24D018B059FBA6F0E60B3.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of
view with reasons and information.

53F6D09C5A61479C80CF3A6807F68B7A.description: Create readable documents with legible handwriting (cursive).

704531AFC8F2456788BB99C66F6DB5DD.description:
Use context to confirm orself-correct word recognition and
understanding, rereading as necessary.

C07D69D19BF14E2289EB4241765EF4B6.description:
Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

2A8E909AB9CC48B1B8A071D4A915617A.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

E7772AFF5C4E477DAE4A8D8966649B6D.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
comprehension.

0829ABE4536A4F50BED271BD29E85C2B.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences,syllabication patterns, and morphology
(e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar
multisyllabic wordsin context and out of context.

7C4D3E3A86794CD68D72A07C9D731D99.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysisskillsin
decoding words.

0C7038DB897741DD9E5DF39E0DD365D1.description:
By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts,
including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in
the grades 4â5 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

AB9FBBCFCCE44FE39FE5A0FD8D9BE81C.description:
Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order
to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

4140E79800BD49FB866F0E999CB05255.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support
particular points in a text.

57FE37B1D84943F9B09F996A74B6E2D6.description:
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively
(e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or
interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the
information contributes to an understanding of the text in which
it appears.

139C80161AB24F43B238CE9AAF38B25E.description:
Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of
the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and
the information provided.

6045A70BB39A49F1A0C7189DF581EC2F.description:
Describe the overallstructure (e.g., chronology, comparison,
cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or
information in a text or part of a text.

0583A12A2C0C48B1A72EAB7E0CF979C0.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domainspecific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or
subject area.

8411A694B00A47CE8518415CAD9CB8F6.description:
Explain events, procedures, ideas, or conceptsin a historical,
scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why,
based on specific information in the text.

0184D82AE4CA4359BE15F304502F81B8.description:
Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is
supported by key details;summarize the text.

0231FE17123F4D2BAA1BAB2E0FA9D483.description:
Refer to details and examplesin a text when explaining what the
textsays explicitly and when drawing inferencesfrom the text.

4EC3BFF161EC431FB9E67D1C09DC4CCA.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4â5 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the
high end of the range.

5A0AB3E0DBCA4FDEBFFE34D692068BBE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3BA0261FF1A044E199C123000F39A125.description:
Compare and contrast the treatment ofsimilar themes and
topics(e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events
(e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from
different cultures.

D33F66E769694B6BB09678886602A336.description:
Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a
visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each
version reflectsspecific descriptions and directionsin the text.Â

F22AD441382A4A4BA5DDE61BD8C0F3EB.description:
Compare and contrast the point of view from which different
stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and
third-person narrations.

3E9BFFFDBA4A494FB9E10F45717642E3.description:
Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose,
and refer to the structural elements of poems(e.g., verse,
rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings,
descriptions, dialogue,stage directions) when writing or
speaking about a text.

8A20A57810984EB393B26713D3CB980B.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in
a text, including those that allude to significant charactersfound
in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

2516C2F8BE8D4F5888F68ABF2799A400.description:
Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or
drama, drawing on specific detailsin the text (e.g., a characterâs
thoughts, words, or actions).

09D5AC0B162541A6B399309F979070AD.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from detailsin
the text;summarize the text.

1811E04A3E324669BD7964ABC9A69D5A.description:
Refer to details and examplesin a text when explaining what the
textsays explicitly and when drawing inferencesfrom the text.
